title.rendered: Nutricost Alpha Lipoic Acid 600mg Per Serving, 240 Veggie Capsules

content.rendered:
Nutricost Alpha Lipoic Acid ( 240 Caps )

Alpha-lipoic Acid (ALA) is a naturally occurring antioxidant, essential for the function of 5 enzymes involved in glucose and amino acid metabolism. Nuticost Alpha-lipoic acid is both a  coenzyme and potent antioxidants.

Mitochondia, which are our cells enegy geneators utilize Alpha- liphoic Acid fo both potectin and to geneate cellula energy. Being Active in both the water and the fatty compartments of cells whee Alpha- liphoic Acid fights free radicals throughout the body and helps promote healthy blood sugar metabolism as part of a healthy diet, supports mitochondrial energy production, support the bodies defenses against free radicals, recycle antioxidant nutrients such as Vitamin C and Vitamin E and supports Glucose Metabolism and regenerate Antioxidants.

How Alpha Lipoic Acid Works?

Alpha-lipoic acid has been found to help prevent certain kinds of cell damage in the body, and also restore vitamin levels such as vitamin E and vitamin C. There is also evidence that alpha-lipoic acid can improve the function and conduction of neurons in diabetes.

Alpha-lipoic acid is used in the body to break down carbohydrates and to make energy for the other organs in the body.

Alpha-lipoic acids has been found to work as an antioxidant, which means that it might provide protection to the brain under conditions of damage or injury. The antioxidant effects might also be helpful in certain liver diseases.

Why you should choose Nutricost Alpha Lipoic Acid

Nutricost Alpha Lipoic Acid uses High- Quality Alpha Lipoic Acid, tested in independent (Third Party) ISO- Accredited Laboratories, Non-GMO, Gluten-Free and Made in the USA.

Seanmag 888 offers two packs which contain either 120 Capsules or 120 Capsules of Premium Nutricost Alpha Lipoic Acid for the best prices in Australia for your benefit.

Dosing Considerations For Alpha-Lipoic Acid

The following doses have been studied in scientific research:

BY MOUTH:

For treating type 2 diabetes and improving symptoms such as burning, pain and numbness in the legs and arms: 600 or 1200 mg is recommended daily or as directed by a physician.

Ingredients:

Alpha lipoic acid, vegetable capsule (HPMC), rice flour, vegetable magnesium stearate, microcrystalline cellulose, silicon dioxide

Directions:

As a dietary supplement, take up to 2 capsules daily, preferably with food,  with 236.59 – 325.56 mL of water or as directed by your physician.

Safety Information:

This product is only intended to be consumed by healthy individuals 18 years of age and older. Consult your physician prior to use if you are pregnant or nursing. Do not exceed recommended use. Some Individuals may experience nausea if taken on an empty stomach. Nutricost Alpha Lipoic Acid Capsules should only be used in conjunction with a healthy diet. Improper use will not improve results and is not advised. Keep out of reach of children. Store in a cool dry place. Do not use if safety seal is broken.

CAPSULE

2/DAY

Legal Disclaimer

The information provided by “Seanmag 888” is for general informational purposes only. All information is aimed to show you accurate information that is accurate. Manufacturers and suppliers have supplied what you see here and ” Seanmag 888” has not verified it.

TGA Health Disclaimer

We at “Seanmag 888” make no ‘ therapeutic claims’ with regard to any product. Therapeutic is defined by the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) as:

1- Preventing, diagnosing, curing or alleviating a disease, ailment, defect or injury in persons or animals; or
2 – Influencing, inhibiting or modifying a physiological process in persons or animals; or
3- Testing the susceptibility of persons or animals to a disease or ailment; or
4- Influencing, controlling or preventing conception in persons; o
5- Testing for pregnancy in persons; o
6- The replacement or modification of parts of the anatomy in persons or animals

If there are healthcare concerns or questions, please contact your licensed healthcare professional for advice.
